description: Provides a Route 53 Resolver DNS Firewall rule resource.

tfcfnid.description: Internal identifier for tracking resource changes. Do not use.

Action.description: The action that DNS Firewall should take on a DNS query when it matches one of the domains in the rule's domain list. Valid values: `ALLOW`, `BLOCK`, `ALERT`.

BlockOverrideDnsType.description: The DNS record's type. This determines the format of the record value that you provided in BlockOverrideDomain. Value values: `CNAME`.

BlockOverrideDomain.description: The custom DNS record to send back in response to the query.

BlockOverrideTtl.description: The recommended amount of time, in seconds, for the DNS resolver or web browser to cache the provided override record. Minimum value of 0. Maximum value of 604800.

BlockResponse.description: The way that you want DNS Firewall to block the request. Valid values: `NODATA`, `NXDOMAIN`, `OVERRIDE`.

FirewallDomainListId.description: The ID of the domain list that you want to use in the rule.

FirewallRuleGroupId.description: The unique identifier of the firewall rule group where you want to create the rule.

Name.description: A name that lets you identify the rule, to manage and use it.

Priority.description: The setting that determines the processing order of the rule in the rule group. DNS Firewall processes the rules in a rule group by order of priority, starting from the lowest setting.
